system.description: Heralds of the awe-inspiring beauty of creation. While the painter and sculptor decorate space, a Bard decorates time.

features.name: Virtuoso
features.description: During Combat, you can use your Action or skip your Move to perform with a Musical Instrument you have Equipped. When you do, your Allies that can hear you gain Favor on certain rolls of your choice until your next Turn: Inspiration: Healing rolls (as d6 bonus), Resolve: Saves, Valor: Attack or Cast Checks.

features.name: Well-Versed
features.description: You ignore Prerequisites for Perks, and take a Perk of your choice now.

features.name: Song of Rest
features.description: During a Breather while you are not Incapacitated, you and your Allies gain a Studied die and regain additional HP equal to (your Presence + your Bard Level).

features.name: Starstruck
features.description: When you perform Virtuoso, you can choose a Near Enemy who hears the performance and make a Performance Check. If you pass, you can choose one of the following Statuses that affects it for Cd4 Rounds: Berserk, Charmed, Confused, Frightened.

features.name: Bravado
features.description: Your Will Saves cannot be Hindered while you are not Incapacitated, and you can ignore effects that rely on you hearing them to be affected (such as a banshee's scream).

features.name: Encore
features.description: Your Starstruck Feature can now affect all Near Enemies.
